Suvon Surgical is a distributor of Arthrex, Inc.




Description

The purpose of this position is to provide hands on management of the medical education process in order to fully educate our surgeon customers and technology consultants, and to satisfy optimum utilization of Arthrex's products and procedures in a safe and effective manner.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Provide technical and clinical support for the a constantly evolving training curriculum.
Assist in the training and development of all representatives.
Assist in the organization and execution of cadaver surgical skills workshops.
Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of current and classic concepts in orthopedics, the product line, and clinical procedures supported by Arthrex products; be able to articulate and demonstrate these concepts and procedures to reps and HCPs.
Teach basic orthopedic concepts including current and classic concepts of patho-anatomy, biomechanics, and pathology classifications related to Arthrex products and procedures.
Provide input for education courses and surgical skills lab agendas.
Teach the safe and effective use of Arthrex products and procedure-specific surgical and non-surgical techniques using Arthrex instruments.
Communicate with representatives, as well as current and new customer accounts, regarding a variety of topics, including latest techniques and literature, peer-reviewed articles, white papers, product updates, changes to product portfolio, and educational programs.
Support compliance and the principles of responsibility (AdvaMed) by maintaining the privacy and confidentiality of information; protecting the assets of the organization; acting with ethics and integrity; reporting non-compliance; and adhering to applicable federal, state & local laws and regulations, accreditation & licenser requirements, and Company policies & procedures.
Participate in and attend sales meetings, surgical trainings, and professional association meetings outside of regular business hours, as required, on a flexible full time schedule.




Requirements

Knowledge and Skill Requirements/Specialized Courses and/or Training:

Excellent communication skills both verbal and written and customer service skills.
Excellent attention to detail, proofreading and organizational skills.
Ability to perform detailed work accurately.
Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.

Educational Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in one of the bio-medical sciences or related fields is required.
Experience as an athletic trainer, physician assistant, surgical scrub tech, or nurse practitioner is a plus.
Experience and knowledge of the Orthopaedic Industry is a plus.
Pre-Graduate, Professional, or Medical School 'gap year' applicants would be considered.

Travel and Flexibility:

Travel to Arthrex and Industry Trainings and Meetings approximately twice a year.
Flexibility of schedule is required.

DayTwo is the leading microbiome-based precision nutrition company. DayTwo provides a food as medicine solution to help members manage their blood sugar levels based on their unique profile of their gut microbiome.




DayTwo members can eat what they love with small modifications and achieve balanced blood sugar levels while also reducing medications. Our unique app allows members the ability to create meals that reduce the incidence of high blood glucose levels and allows for better management of Type 2 Diabetes, as well as overall health. DayTwo is the leader in precision nutrition that enables a path to remission for metabolic disease. Our customers include some of the largest employers and payors in the US.

About the Role¬†

We are seeking an accomplished¬†Creative Director¬†to lead our dynamic creative team. In this new role, you will oversee the development and execution of creative concepts, campaigns, and projects across mediums and channels including print, digital, video, OOH, and social media. As a collaborative leader, you will partner closely with the Content Director on key creative, jump in and design as needed with the design team, and be a champion of the creative on the marketing team. Our ideal candidate will also bring video production expertise and a passion for leading projects that drive differentiation.




Key Responsibilities:

Lead, inspire, and manage a team of innovative and driven creatives, fostering a culture of excellence, mentorship, and growth.
Collaborate closely with the Content Director to ensure the creative vision aligns with brand messaging, content strategy, and business objectives.
Oversee the development and execution of visually stunning creative concepts, campaigns, and projects that elevate our brand, drive engagement, and boost conversions.
Jump in and design when needed to ensure timely delivery of high-quality creative work.
Manage, prioritize, and assign multiple projects and deadlines, ensuring exceptional quality and adherence to timelines.
Provide expert-level creative direction and execution, including design and video production.
Concept and work with Agency for video assets completion, including storyboarding, filming, editing, and post-production.
Ensure brand consistency across all creative work and adhere to industry standards.
Continuously research and stay up-to-date with design trends, video production techniques, and best practices.
Be a superstar leader who motivates and inspires the team to reach their full potential and fosters a collaborative environment that drives innovation and creativity.

Key Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in graphic design, fine arts, communications, or related field.
At least 8-10 years of experience in a creative leadership role, with an impressive portfolio showcasing outstanding creative work across various mediums.
At least 5 years of experience working with performance marketing channels, including social media, email marketing, search advertising, display advertising, and landing pages.
Managerial experience leading creative teams.
Video production expertise, with strong knowledge of video production techniques and software, such as Adobe Premiere, After Effects, and Final Cut Pro.
Strong understanding of marketing and branding principles and a track record of creating highly effective campaigns that achieve business objectives.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.
Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines.
Hands-on experience in creative execution, including design and video production.
Exceptional mentoring skills, with a passion for fostering growth and development in team members.
Expert knowledge of design software, including Figma & Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, etc.).

We are looking for a Talent Acquisition Manager to help our company find and retain top talents. You will be entrusted with an ongoing quest to identify talent, create a powerful employment brand and ensure great relationships with both candidates and employees.

The Talent Acquisition Manager will have in-depth knowledge of Maxtena‚Äôs overall business goals and develop and implement a talent acquisition strategy to ensure the right team is in place to support overall business objectives. Duties will involve identifying, attracting, and retaining qualified candidates with a focus on near-term hiring needs and building a long- term strategy and hiring plans. Experience in full-cycle recruiting, employment branding strategies and a sharp eye for talented people is a vital aspect of the Talent Acquisition Manager role.

The position is based in Germantown, MD.

YOUR WORK AT MAXTENA WILL INCLUDE:

Creating a sustainable talent acquisition strategy and hiring plans
Designing, planing and executing employer branding activities
Perform analysis of hiring needs and provide employee hiring forecast
Perform sourcing using a variety of search methods to fill open positions and anticipate future needs
Screening candidates by reviewing resumes and job applications, and performing phone, video or in-person interviews
Assessing applicants' knowledge, skills, and experience to best suit open positions
Ensuring all screening, hiring, and selection is done in accordance with employment laws
and regulations
Managing the overall interview, selection, and closing process
Staying ahead of recruiting trends and best practices
Planing procedures to improve candidate experience
Assisting in employee retention and development
Supervising recruiting personnel
Identifying and implementing talent acquisition technology
Using HR metrics to create reports and identify areas of improvement
Assessing the needs of current employees
Adjusting employee benefits according to observed needs
Attending relevant industry conferences & events
Performs other duties as assigned

REQUIREMENTS:

Must be authorized to work in the U.S.
Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field
Prior experience as a Talent Acquisition Manager, or similar experience in an HR role
Knowledge of applicant tracking systems is preffered
Experience in full-cycle recruiting, sourcing and employment branding
Working knowledge of interview techniques and applicant screening methods
Understanding of all selection methods and techniques
Proficient in the use of social media and job boards
Deep understanding of human resources laws
Willingness to learn different roles and requirements within a company
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Proficient with Microsoft Office
